title: Assistant Brand Manager
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE
Peloton is looking for a passionate and self-motivated Assistant Brand Manager to join the Global Brand & Consumer Marketing team. This person will support the development and execution of Peloton’s integrated marketing campaigns, brand tentpole moments, and activations. They will report to the Senior Brand Manager of Integrated Marketing, and work directly with cross-functional teams like Consumer Insights, Creative, Growth Marketing, Media, PR, Product Marketing, and Content. This role will play a critical role delivering world-class campaigns that tell our unique brand stories at scale, as well as breakthrough tentpole brand moments that help us reach new audiences with a new message. The ideal candidate will have a passion for the Peloton brand and have expertise in supporting the development of integrated marketing campaigns.

YOUR DAILY IMPACT AT PELOTON

Support the execution of global integrated marketing efforts, working in close partnership with cross-functional teams and local marketing teams

Contribute to the development of marketing strategy and creative briefs grounded in consumer, competitive, and brand insights

Socialize marketing campaign strategy with cross-functional partners to ensure cohesive and consistent messaging across consumer segments

Collaborate with Creative teams as they translate your campaign strategy into advertising. Adopt and represent a consumer-first lens throughout the creative development process

Develop and manage timelines ensuring all campaign milestones are met

Grow subject matter expertise on Peloton’s brand and marketing strategy, target consumers and Members, as well as Peloton hardware, software, and content portfolios


YOU BRING TO PELOTON

3+ years of experience managing multi-channel campaigns at scale

Experience developing and driving integrated marketing plans, creative brief writing, and working cross-functionally to execute 

A track record of partnering with creatives (in house or external agency) to develop strategic, on-brand, and results-driven marketing

Project management skills to handle highly cross-functional projects, and multiple projects at once

Ability to work collaboratively and cross-functionally in a fast-paced environment

Ability to balance an array of high-impact tasks in a fast-paced ever-changing environment

Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills, your ability to influence and build relationships is critical

Growth mindset, low ego, intellectual curiosity, and a desire to learn

Experience working across a global organization is preferred

Experience working in a high-growth company is preferred




The base salary range represents the low and high end of the anticipated salary range for this position based at our New York City headquarters. The actual base salary offered for this position will depend on numerous factors including individual performance, business objectives, and if the location for the job changes. Our base salary is just one component of Peloton’s competitive total rewards strategy that also includes annual equity awards and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan as well as other region-specific health and welfare benefits.As an organization, one of our top priorities is to maintain the health and wellbeing for our employees and their family. title: Chief Operating Officer
description:
Job Summary

The Chief Operating Officer (COO) will be a business partner working closely with the CEO on all operational and strategic matters. The COO should have demonstrated an entrepreneurial "ownership mentality" in prior roles and the aptitude to lead all facets of the Company's operation. The COO will share responsibilities with other members of the senior management team to achieve / exceed productivity gains, profit improvement, cash flow, and business goals and objectives.

Essential Duties And Responsibilites

The Chief Operating Officer will be an experienced leader who infuses execution excellence, energy, urgency and accountability into the entire company. The new COO will be a champion of a winning culture and inspire people with a can-do attitude and a hands-on leader on the plant floor. They will lead the organization in driving a daily KPI culture where opportunities are identified and pursued with passion. The COO will provide vision and leadership to the organization; actively driving aggressive financial objectives, attractive operating margins, with high product quality, client focus and delivery standards across the operation.

Partner with the CEO and senior team to strategically position the Company for significant growth, EBITDA margin improvement and gross margin improvement
Inspire and build a manufacturing organization based on LEAN manufacturing. Drive continuous improvement across people, processes, and technology to ensure the Company's productivity gains are repeatable and scalable. Incorporate process and documentation in the culture of the organization.
Work across the organization to apply a data driven approach to every department so everyone participates and sees value in daily KPIs. They will embrace technology but also care deeply about personal relationships.
They will become a definitive leader by valuing and respecting the workforce, learning the business and bringing the tools and discipline necessary to make the Company a world-class manufacturer
With high EQ, along with the broader Executive Leadership Team, act as the face of transformation at all levels of the organization by setting the tone, spurring enthusiasm, and challenging the status quo. Lead a culture of growth, supported by the continued development of appropriate infrastructure, processes and operational efficiencies to integrate recent acquisitions, maximize current financial performance, maintain the highest standard of quality and corporate integrity/compliance, and support the overall growth strategy
Lead supply chain and purchasing to ensure products are cost effective and on time
Position themself as a visible and accessible key leader of the Company and customers by taking a "hands on" approach and driving a culture of customer service, quality, accountability, and integrity


Required Skills / Attributes

Experience operating in a fast-paced environment with private equity sponsored companies; ideally, high growth businesses in the middle market
Five plus years managing multiple distant locations nationally. Global experience is a plus
Ten plus years of manufacturing operations experience.
Experience building and adapting an organization in a high growth environment. They will have experience integrating and getting a multi-location footprint under single, best practice operating procedures. International experience a plus.
Ability to multi-task and work successfully in a fast-paced environment, including being able to adapt readily to frequent changes in processes and priorities
Experience leading continuous process improvement in a lean manufacturing business with custom engineered products. Passion for productivity gains in a highly customized, built-to-spec manufacturing environment.
Engineering background with three plus years of experience in high volume precision CNC machining
Strong organization leadership with team building experience with strong relationships at all levels of the organization
Experience partnering with long tenured employees and making sure methodologies are documented and built into standards
Deep analytical horsepower and experience in use of metrics / KPI's to make decisions and drive performance
Drive a strong culture focused on winning
High level customer service mentality where service is the number one priority with On Time Delivery and shortened lead times to fulfill orders.
Build a high performing culture through the development and coaching of direct reports and their teams
Strong understanding of Human Resources, Sales and Marketing, Accounting, and other key business systems.


Additional Qualifications

Think and act like an owner. Business partner. Customer-focused
Ability to serve as a player/coach, and flex between serving as a high-level strategic thinker/manager and rolling up their sleeves at times
Good listener, charismatic and credible. Strong communication skills and executive presence.
Strategic mindset, able to help people see where we are going but execution focused and willing to do the work
Brings accountability and creativity. Able to leverage people, process, and technology to improve business performance.
Driven and laser focused on goals; metrics and numbers driven
Ability to challenge the status quo and drive change
IQ and EQ. Know how to use data but treat everyone with respect and fairness. A leader of change but brings people along
Visible, approachable, an active leader. Dynamic and charismatic. A teacher, mentor, and coach


Education And Experience

An undergraduate degree is required. An MBA or other relevant advanced degree is preferred
Must have experience in most/all Required Skills listed above

PHYSICAL JOB REQUIREMENTS

Regularly required to stand and reach the duration of shift, 8-10 hours
Occasionally required to walk, sit, stoop, kneel, crouch, or bend
Frequently required to perform repetitive or short-cycles work

title: Budtender
description:
Company Description

AYR Wellness is a publicly traded, multi-state cannabis company with more than 85 dispensaries. We are one of the largest scale producers of high-quality cannabis in the U.S., and our purpose is to be a force for good. People are at the heart of everything we do, and we are passionate about bringing progress and positive changes to our communities, our industry, and our world.

Our talented and reliable team members are the foundation of our business and investing in exceptional talent is paramount to our success. The key to building a culture where everyone can thrive starts and ends with our teams. Their collective courage and kyndness sets AYR apart. Your career growth at AYR is limitless, and we believe in creating an environment where everyone can flourish and win together.

Job Summary

The Budtender is responsible for providing our customers with an extraordinary experience.  Through meaningful interaction and knowledgeable answers, the Budtender fosters an environment that is compassionate, genuine, and respectful.  Budtenders are expected to contribute to making their Dispensary a climate that encourages forward-thinking, embraces inclusion, and practices generosity of spirit.  Budtenders also assist the Management Team with the activities and operations of the store, while abiding by policies, procedures, and operational guidelines.

Duties And Responsibilities

Provides knowledge, expertise, guidance, and a personalized experience to each customer by explaining the potential benefits of the Premium Cannabis products offered.
Ensures customer questions or concerns are resolved quickly and completely.  Communicate any requests or unresolved concerns to management immediately.
Accountable for accurately receiving, coordinating, and fulfilling customer orders by utilizing the Point of Sale (POS) and inventory tracking systems in compliance with company, local, and state policies.
Adapts to varied sales volume and stays active by initiating continued learning activities, creating an engaging environment, and assisting in keeping the dispensary properly stocked, clean, tidy, and in operating order, while keeping a “Customer first” acuity.
Meets/exceeds day-to-day sales metrics by following the customer experience selling cycle with tailored product suggestions. This includes meeting individual and team-centric sales targets within each dispensary.
Assist management staff in ensuring all procedures are being followed to reflect regulatory and compliance standards.
Fosters a positive work environment, treating everyone with dignity and respect, while perpetuating a curiosity for “everything cannabis”.
Performs other duties as assigned by the Manager and/or Store Lead.

Qualifications

Must be at least 21 years of age
Able to pass all background checks as required by state cannabis agency.
Availability to work retail schedule that includes nights and weekends
Prior customer service experience in hospitality, pharmacy, customer services, or retail environment.
Must stay current and adhere to all policies and regulations of the state cannabis agency
Maintain regular and punctual attendance.

Education

High school diploma/GED required

Experience

1-3 years working in retail or other customer service position, cannabis experience is a plus

Competencies (Knowledge, Skills, And Attitude)

Customer Obsessed - Dedicated to creating a remarkable experience for customers; builds rapport and maintains meaningful and effective relationships creating trustful, authentic connections; viewed as a good listener and is easy to approach and talk to and is often in the know early in any given situation
Adaptable / Flexible - Effectively manages change and adjusts comfortably to new people and processes; multi-tasks and handles ambiguity and stress well while remaining positive; bounces back quickly from challenging situations; asks for help when needed and stays focused on being a force for good.
Learning on the Fly - learns quickly when facing new problems; a relentless and versatile learner, open to change

Direct reports

No direct reports

Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

At AYR Wellness, our vision is to be a force for good in all we do and to bring lasting positive change to our communities, our industry, and our world. And it wouldn’t be possible without our exceptionally talented team. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the uniqueness of each employee and supports their individual journey in finding their genius and pursuing their passion.

AYR Wellness is committed to the policy that all persons have equal access to employment. We strongly encourage applications from people of color, persons with disabilities, women, and the LGBTQ+ community, regardless of age, gender, religion, marital or veterans’ status.

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
Sisley Paris is a French company that specializes in creating and distributing skincare, make-up products, and fine perfumes. Founded in 1976 by Hubert d’Ornano, Sisley was a pioneer in using botanical active ingredients and essential oils in beauty products. With a rigorous approach to research and a focus on Phyto-Cosmetology, Sisley offers innovative and high-quality products.


The Sisley Group is looking for a highly skilled and passionate Digital Marketing Manager to lead our paid media initiatives, enhance customer engagement through impactful digital campaigns, and act as our primary liaison with advertising agencies and digital marketing partners. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in digital marketing, and a keen understanding of social CRM. This role will be report to our Director of Ecommerce / VP of Marketing. Ideal candidates will have 4 to 8 years of experience in Digital Marketing, preferably in the beauty industry.

Core Responsibilities:
General:
Must be an independent thinker with hands-on, can-do, “roll up your sleeves” attitude, an open-minded team player with a collaborative attitude.
Must be highly organized, detail-oriented, and can thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented and high-energy environment.
Ability to work well in a team environment but flexible working independently, meeting goals and deadlines.

Digital Marketing:
Develop and execute digital marketing campaigns across multiples channels, including SEM, social media, display advertising, influencer and affiliates marketing.  
Act as the main point of contact for our digital marketing agency, providing them with essential information, such as budgets, goals, promotional calendar, campaign briefings and creative assets. 
Review and approve all campaigns and assets to guarantee that brand guidelines and objectives are being adhered to. 
Maintain our social media presence constant and relevant through content creation, UGC curation, and agile CRM.
Analyze and report on campaign performance and overall budget pacing and provide recommendations for continuous improvement.
Supervise digital marketing invoices and P&L, ensuring cost-effective campaign management and budget adherence. 
Manage advertising agreements and partnerships, as well as research and connect with new digital marketing vendors.
Stay up to date with the latest industry trends, best practices, and emerging digital marketing technologies. 
Work with other department heads to plan and execute their digital marketing needs (PR partnerships and events, Evites, Masterclasses, Live streaming events, etc.)

Required Experience and Skills:
BS/MS degree in digital marketing, communication or a related field. 
4+ experience working with digital marketing (fashion/beauty industry is a plus)
Experience creating and implementing campaigns for social media, display advertising, lead generation, and SEM. 
Exceptional attention to detail, communication, and organizational skills that contribute to team success. 
Experience with media planning and budget allocation.
Well-versed in the use of social media and digital marketing tools such as Meta Ads, Tiktok Ads, Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Merchant Center, Ahrefs, Sales Cloud, etc.
Knowledge and experience with graphic design tools such as Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch, After Effects, etc. is a big plus.
Highly organized with ability to prioritize and manage deadlines.
Self-motivated with ability to take initiative.

title: Supply Chain & Operations Associate
description:
Welcome to Apothékary™, where Nature is Medicine™. We harness the intelligence of nature by creating clean, effective herbal remedies that target the root cause of health imbalances like helping to ease stress, support the gut, strengthen immunity, boost energy, and sharpen mental focus. Our herbal formulas feature traditional herbs from several medicinal modalities including Ayurveda, traditional Chinese medicine (TCM), Japanese Kampo, and Western herbalism. We believe in getting to the root cause of health issues and herbs can be a great place to start your journey and promote wellness for the long-term.

We were founded in early 2019 by Shizu Okusa, a serial entrepreneur in the wellness industry and named E&Y's Entrepreneur of the Year 2021. After leaving an intense finance career, she became inspired to live a more balanced lifestyle and revisit her Japanese roots and passion for herbal medicine. Shizu set out to help others regain their holistic health using traditions she grew up with and ones she learned along the way.

Why work with us?

You will get the chance to be an early team member at a fast-growth health & wellness startup disrupting the intersection of food and medicine - preventative healthcare rooted in herbal medicine
We are growing fast (100x growth in two years, over $12M in capital raised, and quadrupled the size of the team in the last 9 months)
We're a tight-knit, passionate team, where you'll learn a ton and have ownership over your responsibilities
Work with a seasoned second-time founder and executive team

The role:

Apothékary is looking for a highly detail-oriented and self-starter Supply Chain & Operations Associate to join our team. This role is crucial in ensuring smooth day-to-day operations of our supply chain, inventory management, and distribution processes. This candidate will support the coordination and execution of transportation & logistics activities, ensuring a seamless flow of raw materials and finished goods from suppliers and co-manufacturers to retailers and customers. The role requires meticulous attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and the ability to work with various teams internally and externally to ensure smooth operations in a rapidly growing organization. This role reports directly to the Supply Chain Planning Manager.

Responsibilities:

Responsible for the most safe, efficient, and cost-effective coordination of all raw materials and finished goods between our suppliers, co-manufacturers, retailers & fulfillment center
Partnering with the Supply Chain Planning Manager, strategically plan production requirements working directly with co-manufacturers in an effort to optimize targeted finished goods inventory levels
Monitor inventory levels of finished goods and coordinate with the Fulfillment Team to ensure accurate and adequate inventory levels are maintained
Coordinate with the Quality Specialist and Regulatory Manager to ensure adherence to regulatory standard and dietary supplements requirements
Work with Finance and Accounting to ensure accuracy of all PO's and invoices and maintain various tacking documents
Works closely with our freight partners to schedule pick-ups & deliveries based on receiving availability, while preparing and compiling all necessary documentation
Issues loading instructions to the carriers and suppliers and troubleshoot all shipment related issues, with suppliers, carriers, and internal teams
Issue RFQs to multiple Forwarders and Carriers, organize and review all proposed rates and provide recommendations to Supply Chain Planning Manager
Effectively negotiates with carriers to maintain competitive pricing for all shipments of goods across our supply chain
Act as the primary point of contact with international and domestic retail partners, foreign subsidiaries, distributors, suppliers, brokers, and carriers to ensure compliance with all applicable import and export regulations
Work closely and build a relationship with the Customs brokers and carriers to coordinator timely and compliant flow of shipments
Maintains all record keeping of shipping documents, including packing slips, BOLS & invoices
Works alongside our fulfillment team & co-manufacturers to reconcile inbound shipments, escalating & resolving any discrepancies with suppliers in a timely manner
Comply with the packing and handling guidelines for all shipments in conjunction with product safety and security requirements
Regularly reviews average shipping costs with our logistics partnerships, reporting data to upper management to track progress against KPIs
Maintains strong working relationships with stakeholders from internal team members to external partners such as co-manufacturers, suppliers & freight carriers
Proactive communication and status updates to internal team on transit timelines and shipment status
Participate in continuous process improvements related to inbound / outbound shipments and periodic process reviews, identify gaps, and implement necessary corrective actions
All other duties as assigned

Time and Location:

This is a full-time and fully remote role. This role will work closely with our Fulfillment Team and their hours are primarily 7:00am - 3:00pm EST. Flexibility will be allowed between these hours however a candidate on the East Coast is preferred in order to support the Fulfillment Team.

This position is available to start immediately. Note that job responsibilities may change based on the company's evolving needs.

Requirements

Ideal candidate:

Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Operations Management, Logistics
3+ years experience working in supply chain/logistics. Experience working with a start-up/growth company preferred
Experience in Shopify and Shipstation is a plus
Strong understanding of supply chain processes and procedures including manufacturing planning, demand and replenishment
Strong understanding of transportation & logistics fundamentals and processes
Excellent organizational, planning, and project management skills with the ability to work both independently and in team settings
Excellent communication skills with a high attention to detail and timely follow-up
Systems savvy; able to learn and navigate different systems quickly and efficiently
Coordinate effective communication with team members of a fully remote workforce
Meticulously detail-oriented and organized, with excellent time management
High proficiency in Google Workspace, MS Office, Excel, and the ability to create pivot tables, VLOOKUPs and IF statements
Ability to manage multiple projects and work in a fast-paced environment
Highly collaborative and enjoys working cross-functionally to execute strategies
Natural problem solver with a positive attitude and strong time management capabilities
Unquestionable ethics that drive leadership and behavior.
Passion for wellness community and herbal medicine and a vision on how to connect with consumers in ways that have never been done before


Bonus points:

Working knowledge and understanding of global logistics, imports/exports, international & domestic freight shipments, US Customs, FDA, Hazardous goods, Duty & VAT, Incoterms, & HTS Classification
Experience working in an ERP, TMS, and WMS systems
Previous experience at a high-growth, fast-paced startup, ecommerce, retail, or consumer goods supply chain
Entrepreneurial mindset


Benefits

Compensation

$65,000 - $70,000 annually
Comprehensive health, dental and vision plans
Monthly paid Mental Health Days in addition to PTO
Monthly Apothékary product stipend

title: University Recruiter
description:
Who we are

Stripe is a technology company that builds economic infrastructure for the internet. Businesses of all sizes—from new startups to public companies like Amazon and Salesforce—use our software to accept online payments and run technically sophisticated financial operations in more than 100 countries. By helping businesses accept payments from anywhere in the world and accelerating the economic shift from offline to online, we aim to increase the GDP of the internet.

What you’ll do

To further this important mission, we are looking for a consultative and creative University Recruiter to grow and scale our early talent programs and teams. You can expect high impact and wide-ranging responsibility: owning full-cycle recruiting, driving hiring strategy, leading first-in-kind searches, and delivering best-in-class candidate experience. This person must be a builder who thrives in a learning environment—unafraid to try new things, embrace new ideas, and welcome suggestions for how we can iterate on our processes.

Responsibilities

Partner closely with organizations across Stripe to help build their university recruiting strategy

title: Product Manager
description:
Finonex is looking for a talented Product Manager to join our team in our Herzliya, Israel office.

Our work model is hybrid, combining remote and on-site work, offering flexibility and a dynamic work environment.

As a Product Manager focused on client activation and onboarding, you will shape the first user experience with our platform.

Working closely with the Senior Product Manager, you'll design and refine the journey from sign-up to full activation, ensuring it’s intuitive and effective.

Your work will directly enhance user retention and satisfaction, driving business growth.

On this role you will:

Collaborate with the Senior Product Manager to design a client activation and onboarding process that is both user-centric and aligned with our business goals.
Work together with the Senior Product Manager to manage the lifecycle of client activation and onboarding features, from gathering user requirements to collaborating with development and design teams for successful implementation.
Partner with teams across the organization to ensure the client activation and onboarding experiences integrate seamlessly with other parts of the platform, enhancing overall user satisfaction.
Contribute to the development and execution of a strategic roadmap for client activation and onboarding, turning high-level concepts into actionable features that meet user needs.
Collaborate with designers to create a user-friendly activation and onboarding experience that is both engaging and easy to navigate.
Utilize user feedback and data analytics to continuously improve the client activation and onboarding processes, making adjustments that enhance user engagement and retention.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices to ensure our client activation and onboarding processes remain competitive and effective.

Requirements:

At least 2 years of experience as a Product Manager, with a strong focus on B2C or B2B2C environment.
Proven ability to drive product initiatives and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Capable of translating user needs and market insights into a strategy and actionable product features.
Deep understanding of UI/UX design principles, with the ability to work effectively with designers to create a superior user experience.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to define key success metrics and use data to inform product decisions.
Strong written and verbal communication skills in English, with the ability to present ideas clearly and persuasively.
Proven ability to work effectively in a team setting, closely partnering with the Senior Product Manager and other stakeholders.

title: Product Manager
description:
About NetApp

NetApp is the intelligent data infrastructure company, turning a world of disruption into opportunity for every customer. No matter the data type, workload or environment, we help our customers identify and realize new business possibilities. And it all starts with our people.

If this sounds like something you want to be part of, NetApp is the place for you. You can help bring new ideas to life, approaching each challenge with fresh eyes. We embrace diversity and openness because it's in our DNA. Of course, you won't be doing it alone. At NetApp, we're all about asking for help when we need it, collaborating with others, and partnering across the organization - and beyond.

"At NetApp, we fully embrace and advance a diverse, inclusive global workforce with a culture of belonging that leverages the backgrounds and perspectives of all employees, customers, partners, and communities to foster a higher performing organization."-George Kurian, CEO

Job Summary

The Data Services team at NetApp helps customers protect and govern their data wherever it lives. We drive preference for our primary storage platforms through a consolidated set of data protection and governance offerings. Our team is looking to hire a Product Manager, in this role you will:

Use a customer-centric approach to execute product vision, direction, and business plans, including product plans and roadmaps, product evolution, and the product lifecycle process.
Specify technical requirements, develop a roadmap, and provide technical direction.
Create customer-facing collateral, launch materials, and participate in other activities to evangelize the product and solution.
Define and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to determine success.
Gather and analyze customer data to identify adoption friction, trends, and other customer pain points to inform roadmap decisions.
Keep track of competition and develop competitive analyses.


Job Requirements

3+ years of experience in product management in B2B or cloud businesses.
A bachelor's or master’s in engineering is required.
Experience delivering technology products from ideation to post-launch.
Knowledge of multiple functional areas such as product management, engineering, UX/UI, customer support, or marketing is highly desired.
Familiarity with the storage industry and cloud technologies is highly desired.
Experience with cloud technology and IaaS/PaaS products, especially Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud.
Experience in IT and security infrastructure products is an advantage.
Ability to manage multiple cross-organizational projects with different customers and stakeholders
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Proven ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and ever-changing environment.
Results-oriented growth mindset with a focus on achieving measurable outcomes.
Demonstrated the ability to lead and influence teams towards a common goal.
Fluent English is required


Equal Opportunity Employer:

NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, and any protected classification.

In a world full of generalists, NetApp is a specialist. No one knows how to elevate the world's biggest clouds like NetApp. We are data-driven and empowered to innovate. Trust, integrity, and teamwork all combine to make a difference for our customers, partners, and communities.
